artist: Manufacturer: Van Gytenbeek Mfg. Co., Inc.
description: train with 3 passenger cars and 1 freight car, on a pedestal; wagons, oxen, horses and train in relief on one side of pedestal; Native Americans and dogsled on opposite side
inscription:
Inscriptions

on PL side, in relief: [PIONEER TRAIN OF THE MOHAWK 7 HUDSON RAIL ROAD--1831]; on PR side, in relief: [FIRST TRAIN IN NEW YORK STATE, OPERATED BY NEW YORK CENTRAL]; in front, in relief: [ONE OF THE FIRST / TRAINS / OPERATED IN AMERICA]; on back, in relief: [TRAVEL TO SUCCESS / BY SAVING]; on bottom, in relief: [VAN GYTENBEEK MFG. CO. INC. / NEW YORK (c) 1930 / DESG (loss) APP.]
title: "Mohawk and Hudson Railroad" still bank
